snippet: The City Council plans to approve several changes, including a citizen review board for the police department and a reduction in court fines that have disproportionately affected black residents.
abstract: Ferguson, Mo, City Council, in first major sign of change in city since police killing of black teenager Michael Brown, says it will establish citizen review board to provide guidance for police department; also announces sweeping changes to its court system, including reduction in court fines that have disproportionately affected low-income black residents.

byline.contributor: Julie Bosman contributed reporting from St. Louis.

lead_paragraph: The City Council plans to approve several changes, including a citizen review board for the police department and a reduction in court fines that have disproportionately affected black residents.

headline.main: Ferguson Sets Broad Change for City Courts
headline.print_headline: Ferguson Sets Broad Change for City Courts
